cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, then slowing and bending northwest toward the southeastern Louisiana and Mississippi coasts before drifting northward inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Louisiana/Mississippi coast (between Morgan City, LA and Ocean Springs, MS)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of Ocean Springs, MS to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Ocean Springs, MS to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana across Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if Sally strengthens more than forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible along the Mississippi/Alabama border to the Alabama/Florida border, including Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with locally higher amounts possible; significant flash and river flooding expected across southern Alabama.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Monday afternoon; dangerous surf and rip currents.
